sentences: Lê Thành Nguyên; born 14 January 1959) is a French jazz musician and composer of Vietnamese ancestry.
His 1996 album Tales from Viêt-Nam blends jazz and traditional Vietnamese music.
In spring 2011 he released Songs of Freedom, an album with cover versions of pop hits from the 1970s.
1990: Miracles (Musidisc), with Art Lande, Marc Johnson and Peter Erskine
1992: Zanzibar (Musidisc), with Paul McCandless, Joël Allouche
1995: Million Waves (ACT), with Dieter Ilg and drummer Danny Gottlieb
Tales from Vietnam (ACT), with Huong Thanh, Hao Nhien, Paolo Fresu, Trilok Gurtu, Simon Spang-Hanssen, Michel Benita
2000: Bakida (ACT), with Renaud Garcia-Fons and Tino di Geraldo featuring Carles Benavent
2006: Homescape (ACT), duos with Paolo Fresu and Dhafer Youssef
The Othello Syndrome (Winter & Winter)Within ELB, including with Peter Erskine and Michel Benita
2008: Dream Flight (ACT), featuring Stéphane GuillaumeWithin Andy Emler Mega Octet
Silent Ways (ACT)With Romano/Sclavis/Texier + Enrico Rava, Bojan Z
